entry.title: Actual Costing in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Actual Costing is available in SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA Cloud, public edition) with the scope item 33Q.

How Actual Costing Works

Actual costing valuates all goods movements (procurement, manufacturing, stock transfers, subcontracting, etc.) and collects any incurred variances for your materials within a period, and calculates their actual prices, which are usually more accurate than standard prices (S-price) and moving average prices (V-price) in reflecting actual costs of the products.

At period end, the actual prices are also used to revaluate your consumption, e.g. COGS (cost of goods sold), and period-end inventory. Valuation at actual cost is not only helpful but also legally required in some countries/regions as your financial statements, such as Profit & Loss statement and Balance Sheet, can be updated with the actual costing results.

Actual Costing helps you gain real-time insights into business performance and make informed decisions, especially in industries or organization with big fluctuations in raw material prices or volatile production processes.

Now, let’s look at a simplified example to better understand how it works. 

Example Process 

In this example, various transactions are involved to demonstrate how price variances are collected from purchase of the lower-level material and production of the finished goods, how the variances are then allocated to cost of sales and remaining inventory, and what revaluation journal entries are posted to reflect the real product profitability.

Let’s walk through each step to see how data is processed in Actual Costing:

Transactions in Example Process

1. Create a Purchase Order

Company code 1210 has EUR as its local currency (company code currency). The raw material RM124 has a standard price of 0.35 EUR/PC in plant 1210 in period 008/2025 as shown in the material master record below:

Master Data of Raw Material

A purchase order (4500000253) is created, ordering 100 pieces of RM124 with a net price of 0.50 USD/PC from a foreign supplier.

Purchase Order of Raw Material

Note that the total PO price of 50 USD is converted into 40.39 EUR with the exchange rate 1.23794 effective at PO creation. This leads to a price difference of 5.39 EUR between PO price and standard price (40.39 – 35.00 = 5.39 EUR).

Exchange Rate of Purchase Order

2. Receive Goods for the Purchase Order

Following goods receipt of 50 PC of RM124 into inventory, you can see the price difference is collected in the Actual Costing app – Material Price Analysis (CKM3N):

Goods Receipt in CKM3N

By selecting the goods receipt line and choose Source Document, you will find the price difference of 5.39 EUR is debited as a net loss in a P&L account under transaction key PRD in the Accounting document:

Goods Receipt Journal Entry

3. Receive Invoice for the Purchase Order

When we receive the invoice for the PO, the exchange rate from USD to EUR has changed to 0.9.

Invoice Receipt

Therefore, the invoice value of 50 USD is converted into 55.56 EUR.

Exchange Rate of Invoice

This results in an exchange rate difference of 15.17 EUR (55.56 – 40.39 = 15.17 EUR) debited under transaction key KDM in the Accounting document.

Invoice Journal Entry

Material Price Analysis (CKM3N) also receives the exchange rate difference in a separate line as below:

Invoice Receipt in CKM3N

4. Create a Production Order

Now that the required raw material RM124 has received into inventory, the plant 1210 is ready to starts its manufacturing of the product SG224-DEMO. For this, a production order (1011288) of 50 PC of SG224-DEMO is created:

Production Order

According to bill of materials (BOM) and routing of SG224-DEMO, the following raw materials and production activities are required to manufacture 100 PC of SG224-DEMO:

Planned BOM and Routing

5. Goods Issue, Time Confirmation, and Goods Receipt for the Production Order

In the actual manufacturing process, variances can happen in the consumption of components (input materials) and activities. In  this example, we confirm more working time for activities Setup (activity type 3), Machine (1), and Labor (11) than planned.

Time Confirmation for Production Order

Due to the Backflush indicator, with the time confirmation above, the withdrawal (goods issue) of input materials (RM124) is posted automatically.

Since the final operation 0020 has the Automatic Goods Receipt indicator flagged, confirmation of 0020 also results in a full delivery (goods receipt) of 50 PC into inventory.

6. Settle the Production Order

Since 1011288 is an event-based production order, full delivery automatically triggers the order settlement. We can check the production variances in app Order Costs Details - Event-Based:

Production Order Variances

The total production variance is 407.08 EUR, split into different variance categories, reflecting the causes of the variances. The variance is debited as a net loss in P&L account under transaction key PRD in the Accounting document.

Production Order Settlement Journal Entry

Note: The above-mentioned features are related to Production Accounting (3F0) and are not the main goal of this blog. You can find more details in SAP help (https://help.sap.com/s4_ce_prd_acc).

Now we can look at how the goods receipt and production variance of SG224-DEMO is captured in Material Price Analysis (CKM3N):

  • Goods receipt of 50 PC is evaluation as 341.00 EUR (50 PC multiplied by standard price 6.82 EUR) as shown in Preliminary Valuation column.
  • The production variance of 407.08 EUR collected from order settlement is shown as Price Difference.

Order Settlement in CKM3N

7. Create a Sales Order and Outbound Delivery

Following the completion of production of SG224-DEMO, we create a sales order (1516) to sell 20 PC of SG224-DEMO at the price 10 EUR/PC to a customer. Then we issue the goods to the customer with an outbound delivery document (80000286):

Sales Order Created and Delivered

The goods issue is updated in Material Price Analysis (CKM3N) under Consumption as follows:

Goods Delivery of Sales Order in CKM3N

Before the actual costing settlement, the sales quantity of 20 PC is still evaluated using standard price 6.82 EUR (6.82 EUR * 20 PC = 136.40 EUR).

Note that the profitability segment 106851 is derived from the sales order item. It combines all the relevant attributes of the sales order, including sales order ID, sales org, distribution channel, customer group, ship-to party, etc.

Profitability Segment of Sales Order Item

8. Settlement in Actual Costing

At the period-end close, we execute the Actual Costing run in CKMLCP (Edit Actual Costing Run), also known as costing cockpit.

Settlement Completed in Actual Costing Run

Note: Before the settlement in Actual Costing, make sure you’ve run the WIP Quantity Calculation job in Schedule Inventory Accounting Jobs for accurate WIP revaluation in Actual Costing. Also, remember to calculate actual activity cost rates in the Actual Cost Rate Calculation - Cost Centers app. These steps are not demonstrated in this example.

In the settlement step, the system does the following:

(1) Determine any price and exchange rate variances of lower-level materials (RM124 in our example).

In the Cumulative Inventory line, Actual Value (90.56 EUR) is a sum of preliminary valuation value, price difference and exchange rate difference. The actual price 0.45 EUR/PC of RM124 by dividing the actual value (90.56 EUR) by the cumulative quantity (200 PC).

Note that according to the ratio of consumption quantity/cumulative quantity (50 PC/200 PC), the production of SG224-DEMO only shares 1/4 of the total difference (5.39 EUR + 15.17 EUR = 20.56 EUR), that is 5.14 EUR (20.56 EUR/4). Raw Material Settled in CKM3N

(2) Roll the variances through to higher materials (SG224-DEMO) that used the lower-level materials.

In Material  Price Analysis of finished goods SG224-DEMO, 5.14 EUR from lower material (RM124) is rolled up, divided into 1.35 EUR of price difference and 3.79 EUR of exchange rate difference.

Product Settled in CKM3N

(3) Calculate actual price (periodic unit price).

Actual price is calculated for each of the materials as shown above: 0.45 EUR/PC for RM124 and 15.06 EUR/PC for SG224-DEMO. These prices can reflect the actual cost more accurately, as all goods movements and cost fluctuations within the period are considered.

(4) Allocate the cumulated variance (and cumulative actual value) to consumption and ending inventory.

As shown in screenshots of points 1 and 2, the cumulative differences are allocated to consumption and ending inventory in proportion to the quantity as follows:

MaterialCumulative Difference (EUR)Consumption (EUR)Ending Inventory (EUR)
RM12420.56 (= 5.39+15.17)5.14 (=20.56*1/4)15.42 (=20.56*3/4)
SG224-DEMO412.22 (=408.43+3.79)164.89 (=412.22*2/5)247.33 (=412.22*3/5)

With that, consumption and ending inventory are revaluated as shown in Actual Value column.

9. Post Closing Documents

Now that the cumulative differences are allocated and actual values of consumption and inventory are revaluated, we can post the closing entries to ACDOCA (Universal Journal) to adjust the consumption (e.g. COGS for SG224-DEMO) and ending inventory values, so that the relevant P&L accounts and B/S accounts are updated.

To do that, select both Revaluate Material and Revaluate Consumption when executing Post Closing in the costing cockpit (CKMLCP),

Run Parameters of Post Closing Step

The Post Closing step is executed successfully.

Closing Journal Entries Posted

In Material Price Analysis, you don’t see much changes except the Period Status is updated to Closing Entries Completed and the price control of the materials is converted from S (Standard Price) to V (Periodic Unit Price), meaning the material stock has been revaluated at the actual PUP price in the period.

Closing Step Completed in CKM3N

Taking SG224-DEMO as an example, let’s look at what closing journal entries are posted by Actual Costing (you can jump to these journal entries by choosing Closing Document on the screen). These journal entries are classified with the type ML (ML Settlement). ML stands for Material Ledger and Actual Costing is traditionally a part of it.

In the consumption (COGS) revaluation journal entry 4700000034, we can see that the adjustment value of 164.89 EUR together with the COGS splits by cost component. Notice the Account Assignment Type is EO (Profitability Segment). With the profitability segment 106851, as we saw earlier in the consumption line, the sales order item-specific attributes, such as Product Sold, Sales Order, Sales Org, and Customer, are also kept in the line items. Thanks to that, we can get a margin analysis report with the finest granularity to be shared later.

Consumption Revaluation Journal Entry

In the other journal entry 4700000034, by filtering product SG224-DEMO, we can see the following items sorted by transaction key:

  • BSX (Inventory)

Item 44 is a total difference (price and exchange rate differences) of 247.33 EUR is debited to the inventory account, indicating a value increase of the material stock.

  • GBB (COGS)

Item 47 shows a total difference (price and exchange rate differences) of 164.89 EUR is debited to the COGS account.

  • KDM (Exchange Rate Differences)

Items 11 is the exchange rate differences received from lower material RM124. Items 46 and 49 are those credited to the exchange rate difference accounts.

  • PRY (Price Difference)

Item 10 is the price difference received from lower material RM124. Items 45 and 48 are those credited to the difference accounts.

Material Revaluation Journal Entry

Additionally, the items 44, 46 and 45, representing inventory revaluation line in CKM3N, are automatically reversed in the subsequent period (009/2025) as shown below:

Journal Entry Reversal in Subsequent Period

This brings the stock of period 009/2025 back to standard price. Meanwhile, the price differences and exchange rate differences assigned to ending inventory in period 008/2025 are carried over into the beginning inventory of period 009/2025.

CKM3N for New Period

In this way, the system ensures the actual cost of the beginning inventory of the new period equal that of the ending inventory of the previous period.

Note: Price difference for the consumption of 164.87 EUR in period 008/2025 is not reversed.

That concludes the example showing how Actual Costing collects differences of all goods movements along the period, calculates a more reliable actual price, and allocates the differences into consumption and material stock.

10. View Produce Profitability

Following the posting of consumption revaluation, you can view updated COGS in margin analysis report, such as Product Profitability Review Booklet:

Product Profitability Analysis (Production Variances Not Shown)

Here, for 20 PC of the product SG224-DEMO sold, the total COGS 301.29 EUR is a sum of preliminary valuation (136.40 EUR) and the consumption revaluation (163.37 EUR) by Actual Costing as you can see from the CKM3N screen in step 8.

By navigating to the line items, we can confirm that the closing journal entries posted by Actual Costing are considered in the COGS. 

COGS Journal Entry Line Items

Additional Features

This section briefly talks about the Actual Costing features that are not covered above.

Multiple Currencies and Valuations

Actual Costing supports inventory valuation in multiple currency types (company code currency, group currency, and if configured, functional currency) and valuation views (legal valuation, group valuation) achieved by parallel ledgers.

Valuated Quantity Structure

Valuated quantity structure shows the scaled receipt quantity of the actual input materials/activities in a hierarchical view.

The following screen shows the production structure of SG2024-DEMO from the above example, including raw materials and activity types valuated in both preliminary valuation and actual valuation.

Valuated Quantity Structure

The valuated quantity structure helps you analyze the differences roll-ups by showing all the price differences from the lower level to the top material level.

Note this view is dynamically generated without persisting in database, therefore the system performance might be slow in case of many hierarchy levels.

Cost Component Split (CCS)

Cost component split breaks down costs into cost components such as material, various production activities, and overheads. Actual Costing shares the same cost component structure as in product cost planning.

As you can see in Material Price Analysis, the columns such as Direct Material, Material Overhead, Personnel Time, Machine Time, Set-up Time, and Production Overhead represent the cost components. Their values are determined based on the G/L accounts (cost elements) assigned to each component.

SAP is re-designing the cost component split feature with the concept of Universal Component Breakdown. We will explain this feature in detail when available in Actual Costing.  

Activity Consumption Analysis (CKM3A)

Actual Costing also revaluates activity types of each cost center by using the actual cost rates that are determined in Actual Cost Rate Calculation - Cost Centers  app (KSII).

In the following screen of Activity Consumption Analysis (CKM3A), we can tell that for in plant 1210 in period 008/2025, the cost center 12101301 consumes 1.25 hours of activity type 3 (Setup Production) for manufacturing SG224-DEMO with production order 1011288. In reality, there are more production orders and manufactured products.

Closing Completed in CKM3A

The Preliminary Valuation column shows the activity valued with plan cost rates (378.88 EUR/hour) maintained in Manage Cost Rates – Plan or imported from SAP Analytics Cloud. The Actual Value column shows the activity cost valuated at the actual cost rates (388.89 EUR/hour) calculated in KSII at period end.

In the closing journal entries, the price difference is credited to the cost center (transaction key PRL Activity Price Difference)  and debited to the material price account.

Activity Revaluation Journal Entry

Other Fiori Apps

Additional Fiori apps are available for multiple-material view, for example Display Actual Costing Result (F6073). See SAP Help for more info.

In addition, a new comprehensive analytical app is being developed with the aim to remove the current restrictions in F6073.

Technical Implementation:

To use Actual Costing in SAP Cloud ERP, the scope item 33Q must be activated. With 33Q activation, the following are active by default for the relevant plants:

  • Actual cost component split
  • WIP revaluation at actual costs
  • Activity consumption update in actual quantity structure is active and is taken into account upon price determination. 

To access the relevant apps, users must be assigned with a role that contains the following business catalogs:

  • SAP_FIN_BC_IA_AC_PER_ACT_PC (Actual Costing - Periodic Activities) for apps such as Edit Actual Costing Run (CKMLCP).
  • SAP_FIN_BC_IA_FACT_MPRC_PC (Inventory Accounting - Material Price Analysis) for apps such as Material Price Analysis (CKM3N, aka CKM3)
  • SAP_FIN_BC_IA_AC_REP_PC (Actual Costing - Reporting) for apps such as Display Actual Costing Result (F6073).
  • SAP_FIN_BC_IA_OM_REP_PC (Actual Costing - Activity Reporting) for apps such as Activity Consumption Analysis (CKM3A)
  • SAP_FIN_BC_OH_PE_PAC_PC (Overhead Cost Accounting - Actual Costing) for apps such as Actual Cost Rate Calculation - Cost Centers (KSII)

These business catalogs are available in role template SAP_BR_INVENTORY_ACCOUNTANT or SAP_BR_OVERHEAD_ACCOUNTANT.

Master Data Preparation

The materials subject to Actual Costing settlement are those with price control S (Standard price)and price determination 3 (Single/Multi-level) as below:

Master Data of Materials Relevant to Actual Costing

Note: By default, price determination 2 (Transaction-Based) is used in material creation.

See Also

For more deep-dive topics in Actual Costing, for example, WIP Revaluation, Not Distributed, and Not Allocated values, see FAQ Note https://me.sap.com/notes/3617837 (FAQ of Actual Costing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud) with concrete examples.

We will continuously update the Note or publish blogs for other in-depth topics in Actual Costing, such as fallback logic for actual price calculation, account determination for closing journal entries, support of special production scenarios, and configuration activities. You are welcome to leave comments under the blog.

entry.title: Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog
entry.content:
Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog!!!

As soon as such a Business Catalog change is published, as per SAP, "all roles need to be processed to ensure consistency since the data does not have a link anymore between the removed IAM apps and the affected catalogs."

Yes, it processes all roles in the system

In our case, it was 6000 roles in the system. As you can see, the publishing/unpublishing jobs have been running for 7 days now and still continuing. We have been in touch with SAP Support. Their explanation of how publishing works: "In general, it works like this: if a publishing process A is triggered, it is processed right away. If during this process new publishing processes B and C are triggered, this is added to a queue until the publishing process A from before is done. Then B and C will be processed together. Now, if there are 10 or 20 of them queued up, they all will be processed together and depending on the objects, this can take longer. "

There were 30-40 processes running in the system at the beginning. Now after 7 days, it has reduced to 11 processes. It locked up all the business roles for changes during the publishing process - Security team can't make any updates to roles for several days. Developers couldn't create new apps/communication scenarios/services etc. in the system. 

So, what is the workaround for this if someone really wants to remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog? The only way I could think of, is to create a brand-new Business Catalog and move whatever apps that are really needed into the new one. But, what if few months down the line, someone wants to remove another app from that 2nd Business Catalog? ... and so on...

Does this mean, to avoid all this trouble, developers should be allowed to have only one IAM app per Business Catalog? Are there any other possible ideas?

entry.title: Functional area derivation using custom logic in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Functional areas in SAP S/4HANA Cloud are organizational units used for classifying expenses by their nature rather than by operational or geographical divisions. They serve as a key component in cost-of-sales accounting and enable businesses to prepare segmental financial statements for compliance and decision-making purposes. The derivation of functional areas is determined based on the sequence as explained here. In this short blog post, I would like to cover a practical example of how the functional area derivation works using a custom logic substitution rule, which is the last sequence step of the derivation logic. In this demo example, the use case is that the derivation should take place only for the company code 0800, and the default functional area will be substituted by a target functional area which is entered in a custom field of a professional services customer project. The prerequisite is creating and enabling the custom field YY1_Functional_Area_WP_cpd  in the business context "Work Package".

Step 1:

Create a custom logic implementation for the Extension Point FIN_CODING_BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION

Add the following code: in this example, if the Company Code 0800 is used, the custom logic will substitute the default functional area with the functional area entered by the user into the custom field.

* Note: please always copy the values from input to output first before

* any substitutions, otherwise, the initial values from the output will

* be used for substitutions!!

    MOVE-CORRESPONDING codingblockitem TO codingblockitemout.

 

DATA lv_project_target_fa type STRING.

*Only valid for customer projects, as the custom field is created in this context

IF codingblockitem-companycode = '0800'.

    SELECT YY1_Functional_Area_WP_cpd FROM I_WORKPACKAGE

    INTO _project_target_fa

    WHERE WORKPACKAGE = @codingblockitem-wbselementexternalid.

    ENDSELECT.

    "If the custom field value if empty, no substitution

    If  lv_project_target_fa IS INITIAL.

        EXIT.

    ELSE.

        codingblockitemout-functionalarea = lv_project_target_fa.

        substitutiondone = abap_true.

    ENDIF.

ENDIF.

Step 2:

Next, create the substitution rule for this custom logic to be executed. In the “Manage Substitution/Validation Rules – Journal Entries” app, create a new rule for the business context Coding Block as follows:

 

The precondition determines in which cases the substitution rule will be triggered – in our demo use case, we want the rule to trigger only when the source functional area is equal to 'YB25'. The substitution rule itself simply maps the target field value to the value of the source field functional area (which will be set to a new value during the runtime of the custom logic). So essentially, if the customer project custom field has a target functional area 'YB24' maintained, the default functional area YB25 will be replaced by 'YB24'.

Once this is done, we can conduct a quick test to validate the result. The default functional area determined is YB25, and for our test project XDT0031, the custom field has been maintained with YB24 as the target functional area. After completing a test time booking for the project, the derivation result can be successfully validated in the "Display Line Items in General Ledger" app:

entry.title: Professional Services in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts. 

In this blog post I’d like to outline the innovations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in the area of Professional Services. These are the topics that are covered:

  • New Resource Request Status (6JO) 
  • Configurable profit center and partner profit center derivation in new, resource-related intercompany billing (16T, 4AN)
  • Deprecation of Old Resource-Related Intercompany Billing (16T, 4AN) 
  • Enhance Launchpad for Professional Services Project Manager (J11)
  • Additional insight to project manager about purchase requisitions and work packages of professional services projects (J11) 
  • UI Adaptation for Project Control-Professional Services (J11) 
  • AI-assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing (4E9) 
  • Ability to Recognize Revenue based on a Current Foreign Currency Exchange Rate in Fixed-Price Customer Projects (1IL) 
  • Additional Plan Sources in Revenue Recognition for Customer Projects (1IL) 

 

Check out my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

New Resource Request Status (6JO)

This functionality is part of the Resource Management functionality on the BTP which works hand in hand with the project management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In the Staff Resource Requests app, resource managers can now manually set the resource request status to “fulfilled” for bookkeeping purposes. This is helpful when resource requests are only partially staffed to mark these as fully staffed. Besides the automatic determined staffing status, they are able to re-set status from fully staffed manually back to open or to fully staffed. This will help to put focus on requests which really require attention. This status is also available in the request API.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Configurable profit center and partner profit center derivation in new, resource-related intercompany billing (16T, 4AN)

You can now also configure a profit center or partner profit center derivation logic in the new resource-related intercompany billing whereby the profit center derived during the new resource-related intercompany billing can be based on the profit center derived from the related intercompany sales order, in which case the partner profit center will be empty. 

There are several benefits that come hand in hand with this innovation, for one you have a detailed profit center reporting on billing documents and accounts payable and also your configuration can be adjusted to meet different reporting requirements, offering flexibility.

The profit center value is derived for every posting during the preparation of Billing Document Request (RICR). There is a new SSCUI to activate profit center derivation based on the Intercompany Sales Order Item (107061).

If the configuration is unchecked, which is the case by default, the profit center derivation is based on the partner object of the posting.If the configuration is checked, the profit center derivation is based on the intercompany sales order item. The Partner Profit Center field will be empty in this case.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Deprecation of Old Resource-Related Intercompany Billing (16T, 4AN)

 The old version of the Resource-Related Intercompany Billing is deprecated. The new Resource Related Intercompany Billing is the successor providing greater flexibility and transparency. It is recommended to use the new Resource-Related Intercompany Billing. In case you have not yet moved from the old solution to the new solution, we recommend doing so. In case of any questions please feel free to reach out, we are happy to support you in this journey.

There are multiple added values with the new solution, such as flexibility to configure the determination of material that influence the invoice structure, enhanced traceability of billing data with released CDS views, enablement of end-to-end extensibility, enablement of Brazil localization, and removal of restriction on using a single Intercompany Sales Order for a Sender and Receiver company code combination, during billing.

It is a easily switch to the new Resource-Related Intercompany Billing by activating the configuration setting New Resource Related Intercompany Billing activation (ID: 106897). You can continue to use the same “Generate Intercompany Billing” application and scope items after transitioning from the old to the new Resource-Related Intercompany  to process the existing and new intercompany CO journal entries.

For customer tenants with newly activated scope items for Resource-Related Intercompany Billing will have the new Resource-Related Intercompany Billing set as the default.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Enhance Launchpad for Professional Services Project Manager (J11)

There is a new Space template that provides more efficient, user-friendly, and focused experience of SAP Fiori launchpad for professional services project managers. This enhanced role template now includes access to “Project Billing” application, financial reports such as project financial booklet, “Purchase Requisition” application and “Manage collaborative projects” application.

The launchpad space has been split into the following pages for easier navigation

  • Overview
  • Project Planning and Execution
  • Project Billing and Financials
  • Project Administration

The existing space template 'SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF', assigned to the business role 'Project Manager - Professional Services (SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF)', has been enhanced by adding new catalogs and organizing apps across multiple pages, such as Overview, Project Planning and Execution, Project Billing and Financials, and Project Administration, to reduce launchpad clutter. 

Ultimately this new structure leads to increased usability, productivity, and satisfaction.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Additional insight to project manager about purchase requisitions and work packages of professional services projects (J11)

You should already familiar with the “Project Control – Professional Services” application, as we have been mentioning innovations in this app in several of the previous releases and we are continuing to extend the functionality there.

With this release we bring project managers direct insights into work packages and purchase requisition related to professional services projects. This has not been part of this app before and will allow key users to have access to even more information.

Just some examples of the added insights are:

  • Planned efforts, expenses, and costs and revenue
  • Actual efforts, expenses, and costs
  • Cost and efforts estimated to completion & estimated at completion
  • Purchase requisition and Purchase order related insights which are assigned to professional services project

This brings us even closer to providing one single entry point for project managers that gives an overview of project-related information and access to related apps and actions.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

UI Adaptation for Project Control-Professional Services (J11)

The next innovation for the Project Control – Professional Services app is new UI adaptation functionality. Enhancement allows you to create an app variant of the app using SAPUI5 flexibility features in a modification-free way. With an application variant, you can extend the original code to define changes that fulfil the specific business requirements of different business roles, user groups, organizational units, and countries. For example, you might want to create an application variant to simplify and streamline a specific process by hiding fields not required by casual users, visualizing data as a chart, or changing a responsive table to a grid table to make information easier to process.

This means that key users will now be able to customize applications for specific roles or departments, ensuring that each user group has access to the most relevant information and functionality specifically for them. This means for example to add new data sections or new visual elements. They can also change the outbound navigation within an app, for example defining navigation to custom price maintenance app or change the OData Service for UI adaptation project, this ensures that access to app from is consistent and secure.

In this demo you can see a very simple example of adding in a notes tab in one variant of the app, just to show you how this can look like. Please also make sure to have a look at the release blog from Katharina Stopf. There you will be able to find a more detailed video of the step-to-step process of generating this example.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

Extended demo version:

For even more details, please have a look at this introduction video and tutorial for key users.

 

AI-assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing (4E9)

This feature in the Manage Project Billing app assists billing specialists by proposing grammatically correct smart suggestions for the notes of Time and Expenses items in Project Billing Request. This functionality will reduce the time spend manually reviewing numerous notes and accelerates the notes review process, which improves efficiency and accuracy in the billing process. ​It gives the option to either bulk review, which means to review up to 500 note corrections with a single click of the Smart Notes button or do a selective review, so choose up to 500 notes or specific Project Billing Request items for note proposals.​ The AI proposed notes which are saved are also available in the Invoice providing greater clarity.

In the demo you are able to see, that when a billing specialist enters the Manage Project Billing app, they select a billing element and click on the prepare billing button. In the next screen they are able to see the time and expense items including all their notes. When clicking on the  smart notes button you can find the proposed notes section. On the top it will always say that this was created with AI just to ensure the transparency to the users. After using this feature to simplify the review process, the billing specialist can submit and follow the next steps in the billing process as usual.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 Please remember that Andreas Hammerschmidt updates his detailed blog “Project Billing for Customer Projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud” with every release, so you can find a comprehensive overview of the functionality there.

 

Ability to Recognize Revenue based on a Current Foreign Currency Exchange Rate in Fixed-Price Customer Projects (1IL)

 This is especially interesting for countries that tend to experience frequent changes in their currency rate, whereby the foreign exchange rate of the company code to the project currency consistently fluctuates. The revenue recognition key SPFCFX is internally linked to a new event-based revenue recognition currency handling method which uses the project or object currency as the principal currency. In order to leverage this functionality, you need to use the revenue recognition key SPFCFX for the integration with Customer Projects with fixed-price projects to provide revenue recognition data based on current foreign exchange rates for customer projects planned with a foreign currency. 

Let’s have a look at an example. We have a project in India, which means the company code currency is Indian rupee, but we bill in US dollars. Let's assume the exchange rate is changing, in period one it's 1 to 100 in period 5 it's 1 to 120.

The billing plan amount is 100000 US dollars.

In period one we take the current rate based on the project creation date. Let's assume there are some cost postings, and the percentage of completion is 10%. Then the revenue would be 10,000 US dollars.

But the realized revenue in the company code is 1 million Indian rupee.

Let's first look at how the system is handling it today with the with the SPFC standard key.

The rate which is taken into consideration is still based on the project creation date. Let's assume there are additional postings which lead to a percentage of completion of 20% realized revenue, so 20,000 US dollars realized. But the realized revenue in the company code currency is still 1 million rupees.

The new revenue recognition key is considering the first day of the period 5. So here it's 1 to 120.

Instead of realizing revenue and company code currency, Indian rupee of 1 million, we are realizing 1.2 million. The Work in progress overall still is 2.2 million.

To summarize the foreign currency valuation is currently taking reference from the frozen rate versus the end of the month rate. However, with the new revenue recognition key it will take first day of the period rate versus the end of the same month.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Additional Plan Sources in Revenue Recognition for Customer Projects (1IL)

 With this release, you can now use additional plan sources in Event-Based Revenue Recognition for the revenue recognition keys for fixed price projects with the cost-based percentage of completion method (revenue recognition keys SPFC and SPFCTR). This will help. This will empower your financial processes with expanded configuration options, enabling more tailored cost and revenue planning based on project-specific requirements​.

It covers the following:

  • SPFC (fixed-price cost-based percentage of completion):​
  • 305: Confirmed estimate at completion (EAC) from the customer projects planning tools and revenues from the actual sales and distribution (SD) billing schedule​
  • 500: Cost and revenue planning of all objects from ACDOCP based on a configured plan category​
    • SPFCTR (fixed-price cost-based percentage of completion and target revenue):​
  • 305: Confirmed estimate at completion (EAC) from the customer projects planning tools and revenues from the actual sales and distribution (SD) billing schedule​

entry.title: Public Sector highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release
entry.content:
As planned, the Public Sector Management (PSM) Global scope bundle is now available for over 20 countries, including France, Italy, Spain, Ireland, Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Mexico, and Saudi Arabia.  With ever increasing demand, we continue the planned expansion to additional countries in 2602.  Check out the roadmap for details.  

Cloud ERP core enhancements

As always, there’s a range of new core Cloud ERP feature-based innovations for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with the 2508 release. If you are interested in other areas of innovations for SAP’s Cloud ERP, please check out the Release Video from Bert Schulze:

 

 


Screenshot + URL: Get the top highlights of the 2508 release in this video by Bert Schulze

New AI Features for Public Sector

The AI-assisted easy filter in SAP Fiori elements-based applications allows users to define filter queries using natural language, making it easier to find specific entries without manually applying filters. Users can toggle between Classic mode and SAP Business AI-mode, view favorite and last used queries, and easily reset filters to display all entries. ​This feature has now been enabled within the SAP Fiori app, Manage Budget Documents, allowing budget users to use budget document attributes and natural language to easily find what they are looking for.​ AI-assisted filter criteria can be saved as a view and defined as a default view to help make it easier to find these same objects every time, including the ability to save a public or private view.​
​

​Try typing “not posted” and automatically filter on all document statuses except posted.

​

 

Typing ‘sender over 1k usd created in last fortnight’ will automatically filter on large budget transfers in the last 2 weeks.

In the SAP Fiori Launchpad, you can use the AI-assisted enterprise search to access public sector management objects like fund and grant. Depending on your business role, you see a list of business objects in the​ SAP Fiori Launchpad search dropdown. This feature allows you to use natural language for searching public sector management business data. You can enter your search queries in natural language in the SAP Fiori Launchpad search bar to find the information you need.​

Enable natural language search on business objects by selecting the checkbox ’Enable AI Natural Language Search’ from the user profile settings. ​ On selecting the checkbox, you can view the list of business objects that are configured for natural language search.

Try searching “show me funds created recently” and get a list of newly created funds.

   

    
PSM Global

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release delivers a robust suite of Grants and Budget Management features tailored for public sector entities, including state and local governments, non-profits, cities, K-12 schools, and education & research institutions.

Building upon previous releases, the 2508 update introduces new capabilities designed to support public sector customers. Read on for an overview of the latest advancements.

For more details on the global PSM scope bundle, visit the SAP Process Navigator to explore the complete list of available scope items.

Screenshot: Process Navigator focused on S/4HANA Public Cloud and the PSM industry capabilities.


Workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management

Manage Workflows for Earmarked Funds has been enhanced with enabling the workflows for earmarked funds from contract and lease management.

When a lease-in contract is created, earmarked funds are generated automatically, subject to approval settings. You can specify whether all changes, only initial changes, or no changes require approval. The workflow is managed through the "Manage Workflow for Earmarked Funds" step, where properties, conditions, and steps are defined. The default procedure from the Workflow for Earmarked Funds Document is used, ensuring that subsequent processing aligns with the initial setup. (source – Joule!)

​Overview

  • Enablement of workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management
  • Ability to determine approval procedure

Benefits

  • Enable effective budget control by providing the ability for the budget manager to approve or disapprove the commitment from contract and lease management
  • Improve efficiency by streamlining approval process
  • Boost collaboration and compliance

​  

Screenshot: workflow for earmarked funds with Contract and Lease Management.

 

Budget Consumption Review Booklet

Public Sector Management (PSM) now offers the Budget Consumption Review Booklet application to perform a detailed review of the PSM budget line items, commitment/actual lines items, and budget and commitment actual line items and other relevant details.

 * available 2508.1 release, with incremental feature releases over the next few months

Overview:

  • Combines the queries for the Budget Line Item Analyzer, the Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer, and the Budget and Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer
  • Includes pages for each of the 3 reports, viewing each by revenue, expense, or combined
  • Includes all the filters and key figures available in the earlier line item analyzer reports

Benefits:

  • Ability to enter and save comments at the field, page, or report level
  • AI Business Insights and Navigate To features planned for future incremental releases

Screenshot: Budget Consumption Review Booklet

Availability control (AVC) and budget address validations during the import of financial plan data

It is possible to either import PSM budget (via excel upload or via interface from SAC) or create budget documents. During these activities budget addresses and AVC control addresses are never allowed to be negative. Through the “Import Financial Plan Data” app or SAC interface, this new feature checks to avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC and to avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)​

Overview

During the budget upload through the “Import Financial Plan Data” app, new checks to:

  • Avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC
  • Avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)
  • During budget upload and SAC imports the automatic validations are performed and will show possible overruns before the budget data is updated.

Benefits

  • Improve budget consistency (for example, avoiding unwanted negative budgets)
  • This functionality also avoids an accidental deletion of budget data in case the overwrite indicators are set incorrectly. It also avoids the possible deletion of budget documents with header information. ​

 

Screenshot: error message in upload log

 

Using statistical projects with public-sector management

You can automatically derive PSM account assignments from statistical WBS elements when the cost center does not have a fixed assignment. For example, if you set a fixed PSM account assignment on a statistical WBS element and do not set one on the cost center, the system uses the assignment from the statistical WBS element.  This feature allows for better management of budget for statistical projects.

Screenshot: PSM account assignments on a statistical project

 

Position budgeting with funds pre-commitments and budget availability check

  • Enable financing of positions with their corresponding funding sources, such as funds, grants, or functional areas, and monitoring and control of budget consumption
  • Create earmarked fund precommitments in SAP Cloud ERP to reserve the position budget
  • Finance vacant positions

Benefits

Enable accurate budget monitoring and control of personnel expenses by allowing the financing of positions in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Features

When a new employment gets created in SAP SuccessFactors, based on the employment costs, the necessary budget gets reserved in SAP Cloud ERP through an earmarked funds document of type commitment document. When an employee gets hired in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, based on the salary of the employee, the budget gets reserved in the SAP Cloud ERP system through an earmarked funds document, of type Commitment document. During every payroll run for the employee, the existing commitment document gets adjusted with the corresponding payroll actuals amount, and the corresponding actuals document is created and posted in the SAP Cloud ERP.

  • You can finance employees in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central by using Position Budgeting Control for Cloud. The financing uses information from the funds commitment amount in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Position Budgeting Control for Cloud allows you to ensure that employees are sufficiently budgeted for a specified financial period.

 

Picture: Position Budgeting Control – Financing Details.

 

Key Summary

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition latest 2508 release brings key enhancements, including AI-driven user experiences, embedded AI features, and improved Grants and Budget Management capabilities.  This release continues to drive efficiency, scalability, and sustainability in ERP operations for public sector organizations. Please join us in the Cloud ERP revolution and explore how these innovations can unlock your organization’s full potential.

entry.title: 即刻免费解锁：SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 基础 AI 包 (BASE AI)，畅享 Joule 与内置 AI 功能开通指南
entry.content:
在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 中，SAP 提供了三类核心的基础AI (BASE AI) 功能，旨在简化日常操作并提升用户体验。最重要的是——这些功能无需额外成本。它们可通过 BASE AI 包免费开通，或已包含在您的标准云订阅中，提供无限制访问，且无需购买额外的 AI 单元。

本文将详细介绍这三种基础 AI 功能的范围，以及如何开通和获取相应的技术指导。​

提示​​：以下 AI 功能尚未在中国大陆地区上线，建议您咨询您的 SAP 客户经理以获取最新信息。

 

Joule 基础 AI 功能 (Joule Base AI Features)

Joule 是 SAP 的“一站式”AI 副驾驶，旨在通过提供直观、个性化和智能的用户体验来简化日常工作。Joule 拥有一系列覆盖 SAP 云应用程序的技能和能力，目标是支持 80% 最常用的任务和业务流程。

Joule 的基础 AI 功能主要通过以下三种交互模式提供能力：

  • ​​信息型 (Informational Capabilities)​​：Joule 提供简明扼要的帮助内容摘要，以有效回答用户通过自然语言提出的问题。
  • ​​导航型 (Navigational Capabilities)​​：Joule 推荐相关应用程序，并促进无缝导航，使用户能够执行其业务流程。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 500 个导航场景。
  • ​​事务型 (Transactional Capabilities)​​：Joule 提供关于业务对象的深入信息，无需打开相应的应用程序。事务性交互使用户能够访问后端系统并管理业务任务，直接在对话中查看和操作业务对象。SAP Cloud ERP 中有超过 45 个事务场景。
开通方式：

您可以通过SAP Store自助下单免费的SKU或者联系您的销售代表为您下单。

请访问 SAP Store 页面了解并开通Joule 基础 AI 授权

技术设置官方文档​​：
  1. 初始设置Initial Setup
  2. Joule 入门指南Joule Onboarding Guide
  3. 与 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 的集成Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

​​ SAP 也提供了基于Discovery Center Missions​​的指导任务，帮助您一步步理解完成Joule 配置的必要步骤：

  1. 创建Joule实例Establish a Unified Joule Instance
  2. 激活 Joule 与 SAP Cloud ERP Activate Joule with SAP Cloud ERP 

 

嵌入式基础 AI 功能 (Embedded Base AI Features)

这些 AI 功能直接嵌入在您的云 ERP 模块中，主要应用于用户体验等领域，通过自动化和简化任务来改善操作效率。

功能范围：
  • ​​智能摘要 (Smart Summarization)​​：对基于 Fiori Elements 的业务对象进行智能摘要。
  • ​​简易筛选 (Easy Filter)​​：允许用户通过自然语言描述所需数据来筛选列表报告，适用于超过 1100 份报告。
  • ​​企业搜索 (Enterprise Search)​​：支持用户使用自然语言进行企业搜索。
开通方式：

开通嵌入式基础 AI 功能的步骤如下：

  • 注册并接受 SAP AI 条款​​：由客户 S-User 或合作伙伴的 S-User 注册并接受 SAP AI 条款。此操作只需执行一次，适用于 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 的所有系统和租户。
  • SAP 启动激活​​：在您接受条款后，SAP 将启动 AI 功能的激活并通知您。
系统配置：

针对这些功能，SAP 提供了详细的配置指南和用户指南：

  • 智能摘要：配置指南 和用户指南
  • 简易筛选：配置指南 和用户指南
  • 企业搜索：配置指南 和用户指南

 

机器学习基础 AI 场景 (Machine Learning Base AI Features)

这些机器学习功能作为基础 AI 的一部分提供，旨在自动化和简化特定的业务流程，无需额外的许可证费用和申请。

功能范围：

  • ​​销售订单提取 (Sales Order Extraction, Scope Item 4X9)​​：

能够自动从 PDF 或图像格式的采购订单文件中创建销售订单（非结构化数据）。

  • 销售订单自动完成 (Sales Order Auto Completion, Scope Item 73P)​​：

为销售文档中缺失的数据提供建议，加快销售订单和客户退货订单的文档完成。

开通方式：

这些机器学习功能作为嵌入式基础 AI 功能的一部分，无需额外许可证即可使用。它们已包含在标准云订阅中，提供无限制访问。

配置指导：

销售订单提取Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal

销售订单自动完成Recommendation-Assisted Sales Order Completion | SAP Help Portal

 

SAP Cloud ERP 的嵌入式基础 AI 功能、Joule 基础 AI 功能以及机器学习基础 AI 场景旨在通过提高最终用户满意度、改进生产力和节省时间来提升您的业务效率。由于它们包含在标准BASE AI订阅中且无需额外费用，我们鼓励您探索并激活这些功能，以充分利用 SAP 在人工智能方面的投资。

entry.title: Environment, Health and Safety in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public cloud ERP software solution.   

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

 

In this blog post I’d like to outline the innovations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in the area of Environment, Health and Safety. These are the topics that are covered:

  • Management and applicability for compliance obligation registers (4C8)
  • Conversational Incident (Safety Observations) with Joule (cloud) (4YX)
  • Key performance indicators and safety insights for workplace safety (cloud) (4YX)

 

In case you do not need all the information below and briefly want to get an overview of the release highlights, please watch this video with the top three key innovations:

 

 

Video#1: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 for Environment, Health and Safety

 

Management and applicability for compliance obligation registers

Business Background


We delve into the evolution of compliance management with our newly introduced "Compliance Obligation Registers." This capability is designed to streamline the tracking and fulfillment of regulatory and internal compliance obligations, all within a centralized app. With the "Manage Compliance Register," EHS managers can seamlessly navigate through obligations tied to specific locations and subjects like air, waste, and water. The app’s structured interface illuminates each obligation’s applicability and fulfillment status through intuitive colour coding, allowing managers to quickly assess compliance health and pinpoint areas requiring attention.

Key Feature

The integration of an enhanced operational compliance overview app provides stakeholders with analytical dashboards that track compliance performance. This empowers teams to maintain operational continuity by quickly identifying compliance lapses and facilitating swift corrective actions. By optimizing change logs to ensure audit trails and data traceability, businesses can now confidently navigate the complexities of compliance, bolstering both operational transparency and efficiency. Ultimately, this innovation not only promises seamless compliance management but also equips organizations with the insights needed to strategically plan and prioritize their compliance strategies.

 

 

Video#2: Management and applicability for compliance obligation registers

 

Conversational Incident (Safety Observations) with Joule (cloud)

Business Background

Moving on to employee safety reporting, our new AI-assisted "Safety Observation Recording Tool" underscores our commitment to enhancing workplace safety through technology. This tool empowers employees to report safety observations naturally and conversationally, minimizing the friction traditionally associated with incident reporting. By utilizing AI to parse and structure conversational inputs into formal reports, this tool accelerates incident logging, ensuring no detail is overlooked and every safety concern is addressed promptly.

Key Feature

The value proposition of this innovation lies in its ability to promote a proactive safety culture. By streamlining the reporting process, employees are encouraged to participate actively in safety programs, effectively turning every member of the workforce into a potential safety advocate. Moreover, the automatically structured data allows companies to rapidly identify and prioritize safety concerns, prompting timely interventions that mitigate risks before they escalate. This seamless interplay between technology and human initiative enhances safety standards and fosters a collaborative approach to workplace safety across all organizational levels.

 

 

Video#3: Conversational Incident (Safety Observations) with Joule (cloud)

 

Key performance indicators and safety insights for workplace safety (cloud)

Business Background

Finally, our "Workplace Safety Insights" application introduces a new paradigm in safety performance management. By leveraging real-time data, this tool provides managers with dynamic insight cards that enable continuous monitoring of safety metrics. From regulatory compliance KPIs to operational safety trends, these cards offer a multifaceted view that helps managers identify potential risk areas and address them through data-driven decisions.


Key Feature


This innovation is key to establishing a sustainable safety environment by identifying potential issues before they become critical. The real-time analysis allows safety managers to implement preventive actions and corrective strategies, maintaining a high standard of safety operations. Through these strategic insights, companies can not only ensure compliance but also promote a culture of safety vigilance that permeates the entire organization.

entry.title: Product Compliance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public cloud ERP software solution.  

 SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts.  

 

In this blog post I’d like to outline the innovations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in the area of Product Compliance. These are the topics that are covered:

  • Classifying dangerous goods packaged in logistics packing instructions (3FC)
  • EU safety data sheet generation for first scenarios and product groups (7DO)
  • Support of branded products in the safety data sheet process (3VR)

In case you do not need all the information below and briefly want to get an overview of the release highlights, please watch this video with the top three key innovations:

 

 

Video#1: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 for Product Compliance

 

Classifying dangerous goods packaged in logistics packing instructions

 

Business Background

This feature revolutionizes compliance management by enabling users to manage and maintain compliance for products packaged through logistics instructions from handling unit management. By seamlessly integrating with our existing classification app for packaged products, this innovation allows businesses to comply with various dangerous goods regulations more efficiently. The integration not only enhances accuracy in classification but also simplifies the overarching regulatory processes, reducing the complexity traditionally associated with managing dangerous goods.

 

Key Feature

This enhancement facilitates a systematic approach to compliance, leveraging the strengths of both classification apps to forge a cohesive, streamlined process. Companies can now ensure that compliance standards are met across the board by aligning logistic packing instructions with the regulatory demands of dangerous goods. This capability ultimately results in a more coherent compliance strategy that mitigates potential risks and fosters a safer operational environment.

 

Video#2: Classifying dangerous goods packaged in logistics packing instructions

 

EU safety data sheet generation for first scenarios and product groups

 

Business Background

Our safety data sheet (SDS) generation feature has received significant enhancement to support first scenarios and product groups, particularly tailored for European Union compliance requirements. Leveraging integrated regulatory content for GHS specification, this feature ensures that your safety data sheets are comprehensive and meet the highest standards. One of the standout aspects is its incorporation of a starter template, allowing for customization to fit the unique needs of your business while maintaining compliance integrity.

 

Key Feature

A key complement to this is the new preview functionality, which offers the ability to verify end products before distribution, adding an essential layer of quality assurance in documentation. By ensuring the accuracy and compliance of each document before it reaches stakeholders, the enhancement minimizes the risk of non-compliance and potential disruptions. This innovative solution not only supports compliance practices but enhances them, offering a smooth path to achieving regulatory standards.

 

 

Video#3: EU safety data sheet generation for first scenarios and product groups

 

Support of branded products in the safety data sheet process

 

Business Background

Our third key innovation is the support for branded products within the SDS process, which provides an entirely new dimension to product compliance management. This feature allows businesses to create and manage branded products distinctly from unpackaged or packaged ones, ensuring that they are accurately reflected in safety data sheets and other critical compliance documents. This added layer of flexibility allows organizations to represent their product portfolio authentically, while still adhering to rigorous compliance requirements.

 

Key Feature

In addition, the branded products support means that businesses can optimize their regulatory processes for product differentiation, enabling them to stand out in the market while maintaining stringent compliance. By integrating branded names and specific product branding details into compliance documentation, companies are provided with the tools to navigate complex brand management issues with ease. This feature is especially useful for businesses with extensive product lines, permitting them to handle compliance needs across diverse product offerings seamlessly.

 

Video#4: Support of branded products in the safety data sheet process

entry.title: Retail, fashion and vertical business in SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition 2508
entry.content:
Designed specifically for fashion and specialty businesses SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, retail, fashion, and vertical business natively support for enriched product management, advanced pricing, and promotional workflows—all integrated into core ERP processes.

It includes intuitive in-store apps that streamline procurement, inventory management, and omni-channel operations such as buy-online-pickup-in-store. Real-time data access helps store associates stay productive and customer-focused.

With comprehensive end-to-end process coverage, the solution ensures seamless operations across all roles and functions within a retail enterprise and covers key domains including master data, merchandising, supply chain, store operations, and sales. Modular scope items, documented in SAP’s Process Navigator, enable fast activation and reduced implementation complexity.

 

 The 2508 Release adds features across in-store sales, order management, and assortment operations, including hybrid orders, continuous scanning, support for weight-based articles, and mass assortment assignments. Here is a quick summary of some the key highlights in a short video:

 

 

Let’s dive into three key highlights that will help you deliver impact at scale.

Monetize Your Offerings: Charging for Value-Added Services (VAS)

Retail operations often involve additional services—like custom labelling or packaging—that carry extra costs. To manage these effectively, we’ve introduced a feature that allows users to define and assign Value-Added Service (VAS) charge codes directly at the item level in both Purchase Orders and Sales Orders.

These charge codes are centrally configured, making them easy to maintain and reusable across multiple service types. Once applied, they are automatically reflected in all relevant follow-on documents, ensuring consistency and transparency.

This capability supports accurate pricing by including service-related costs in the item’s total value. It also helps businesses offer tailored, premium services while maintaining clear visibility into associated charges—enhancing both operational efficiency and customer perception.


Mass assignment of products in assortments

For category managers and assortment specialists, keeping assortments up-to-date—especially during seasonal changes or new product introductions—can be a time-consuming and click-intensive process. We heard your feedback and have delivered a major enhancement to streamline this critical task.

The Manage Assortment Modules app now allows for the efficient mass assignment of products, transforming a manual effort into a smart, automated workflow.

Recent updates to assortment module management deliver significant improvements in both scale and precision.

You can now assign up to 1,000 products to an assortment module in a single batch—five times the previous limit of 200. This increase is achieved without any impact on system performance, allowing for larger and more efficient planning cycles.

To support more accurate product selection, we've introduced attribute-based filtering. Users can now filter by generic article, as well as specific characteristics like color and size, enabling precise and targeted assortment creation.

The user experience has also been streamlined. The assignment process now begins directly at the product selection list, reducing unnecessary navigation. Once products are assigned to a module, they are automatically removed from the selection list, helping prevent duplicate entries and simplifying tracking.

Together, these enhancements accelerate assortment planning, improve data accuracy, and allow retail teams to focus more on strategic, value-added activities.

These enhancements dramatically accelerate your assortment planning cycles, improve accuracy through attribute-based filtering, and free up your specialists’ time to focus on more strategic, value-added work.

 


Revolutionize In-Store Operations with Hybrid Sales Orders

Imagine a customer in your store. They want to purchase a camera that’s in stock and take it home today. At the same time, they want to pre-order a new coffee maker that is currently unavailable. Previously, this would require two separate, cumbersome transactions. Not anymore.

The 2508 release introduces hybrid sales order functionality in the Manage In-Store Sales Orders Fiori app, enabling store associates to process multiple fulfillment types within a single transaction.

This innovation addresses a common retail scenario: a customer wants to purchase an in-stock item for immediate pickup and simultaneously pre-order an unavailable product. Previously, this required two separate transactions. Now, both can be handled together.

Store associates can create one sales order that includes:

  • Immediate Pickup Items: Entered using standard item categories, with support for GTIN/barcode scanning to speed up product selection.
  • Scheduled Pickup Items: Designated with different item categories and shipping points to indicate future fulfillment.

The system intelligently separates fulfillment flows. When the associate selects “Generate Invoice,” only the immediate pickup items are processed. The system automatically creates the outbound delivery, posts goods issue, and generates the customer invoice. Items scheduled for later pickup remain open for future processing.

This enhancement simplifies operations, reduces transaction time, and allows associates to better serve customers with varied needs—all within a unified workflow.

On the KBA, we instruct how to find extension points (BAdIs) to change information in eDocument generated via eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents apps. entry.title: How to use Data Variants from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Test Automation Tool (TAT) in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Context

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition solution comes with built-in test automation capabilities. Delivered with pre-scripted test processes and post-upgrade test coverage, the embedded Test Automation Tool (TAT) helps accelerate validation cycles and supports the creation of a robust regression test suite.

One particularly powerful, yet sometimes misunderstood, feature of the TAT is the Test Data Container (TDC).

This component allows project teams to define data variants, making it easier to test the same process across different business scenarios. In this blog, we will explore how to define and manage these variants, how automated test cases are synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM, and how the mapping between TAT and Cloud ALM test assets works, along with practical insights into what to expect.

 

Part 1: Understanding Test Data Containers (TDCs) and Data Variants in TAT

The Test Data Container (TDC) serves as a central repository for reusable test data, organized by functional area. It enables teams to manage a single source of test data for end-to-end test flows, which can be reused across multiple processes.

Data variants within the TDC can be defined manually or imported using Excel templates. Each variant represents a specific configuration of data inputs, for example, different company codes, plants, or customer IDs used to drive a specific execution of a test process.

 

Key Concepts

  • A Test Process represents a predefined business process, composed of one or more process steps.
  • A Test Plan in the TAT represents an end-to-end business flow, and may include several test processes.
  • Information can be passed from one process to another within a TAT Test Plan, supporting chaining and data reuse.
  • All test data required for the execution of a Test Plan can be maintained using TDCs and data variants.

Want to learn more? Two of my colleagues have written excellent deep-dives on this topic:
Test Data Container – Use Case
Test Data Container – Features Overview

Part 2: Synchronizing Automated Test Cases into SAP Cloud ALM

Once a Test Plan is created in TAT and assigned with its corresponding data variants, the next step is to synchronize it into SAP Cloud ALM using the Test Preparation app.

Here’s how to proceed:

  1. Click the Import button at the top right of the screen.
  2. Search for the Test Plans you created in TAT that you want to import.
  3. Select the desired Test Plans and click Import.
  4. Choose the appropriate Project Scope and Solution Process (if relevant)
  5. Click Save.

Important Notes:

  • If a Test Plan in TAT contains multiple data variants, each variant will be synchronized as a separate automated test case in SAP Cloud ALM.
    → For example, one Test Plan with 3 variants in TAT = 3 individual test cases in Cloud ALM.
  • In SAP Cloud ALM, the Test Case title is not the name of the Test Process from TAT, but rather the Test Plan name from TAT.
    The Variant field in SAP Cloud ALM is the key differentiator between the test cases derived from the same plan.

 

Part 3: Managing Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM

Once test cases have been synchronized, you can group them into Test Plans within SAP Cloud ALM for structured execution and tracking.

Key Capabilities in CALM:

  • Combine manual and automated test cases in a single Test Plan
  • Assign test cases to individual testers
  • Track execution progress and report results centrally

For a detailed explanation of how to manage Test Plans in SAP Cloud ALM, I highly recommend this blog by my colleague Reiner: Advanced Test Orchestration and Tester Assignment

Clarification on Terminology

It’s important to note that the term "Test Plan" is used in both TAT and SAP Cloud ALM, but the meaning differs:

  • In TAT, a Test Plan defines how a business process is executed across multiple data variants.
  • In SAP Cloud ALM, a Test Plan is an organizational container for execution and reporting purposes.

There is no direct link between the Test Plans in both systems, they are conceptually and technically separate.

Conclusion

The integration between the S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool and SAP Cloud ALM offers a streamlined approach to managing test processes and data variants across the application lifecycle. By understanding the roles of Test Data Containers, how synchronization works, and the difference in test plan concepts between the two platforms, teams can better prepare for scalable and maintainable test automation.

Let me know in the comments if you’ve worked with data variants in TAT and how your team uses them within SAP Cloud ALM!

entry.title: Date Constraints in SAP Project and Resource Management
entry.content:
Meet Deadlines - Date Constraints in SAP Project and Resource Management 
SAP Project and Resource Management (SAP PRM) now allows you to define date constraints to ensure that critical project plan elements (work packages or milestones) start and finish on time. This reduces the likelihood of delays, facilitates the anticipation of bottlenecks, and enhances project scheduling capabilities. 
You can set 'Must Start On' and 'Must Finish On' constraints using the 'Manage Project Plans' app. In the Gantt Chart, constraints are displayed as small red triangles positioned on the top for Start Constraints and on the bottom for Finish Constraints. Milestones are limited to a Planned Finish date, which means they include the finish constraint but do not have a start constraint. 
When constraints are set and scheduling is initiated, any resulting conflicts—such as overlapping project plan elements—are shown as messages for the affected project plan elements, supporting easier access and quicker resolution.  
There are various methods to set or remove constraints, each tailored to specific purposes: 
 
There are various methods to set or remove constraints, each tailored to specific purposes: 
1. Detail Page 
2. Action Button 
3. Gantt Chart 
4. Table View 
5. Project Plan Service API 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Detail Page – Specify Constraints and include a corresponding Note (Reason) while maintaining a comprehensive overview of the selected project plan element:
 

2. Action Button - for setting or removing constraints on multiple project elements: 
Select the project elements you want to modify, then click the 'Action' Button to either add or remove constraints. If you opt for ‘Set Date Constraints’ on a work package, you'll automatically set the Planned Start and Planned Finish as 'Must Start On' and 'Must Finish On' constraints. For milestones, only the Planned Finish date will be set as the 'Must Finish On' constraint. 

3. Right-Click Menu on Gantt Chart – Provides enhanced individual control and quick access for adjustments within the Gantt view: 
Right-click on the relevant bar and select 'Set Date Constraints' or 'Remove Date Constraints' to choose whether to apply or remove the 'Must Start On' or 'Must Finish On' constraint. 
 

4. Table view – quick date entry by tabbing through constraint fields: 
Utilize the table settings to reveal the columns: ‘Start Date Constraint’ and ‘Finish Date Constraint’. Switching to the ‘Display Table’ view provides a clearer overview of the project plan in table format.
